correction_response:
This tweet is accurate. President Biden does have the legal authority to cancel student loan debt, as outlined in Section 432(a) of the Higher Education Act. This authority has been used before to cancel the debt of students defrauded by for-profit colleges and to cancel the interest on federal student loans. However, it's worth noting that there is a divide in opinion on whether the president should use this authority, with some Republicans arguing that he has exceeded his legal authority.
